title: Gothic headline font ID?
content:
This one could ALMOST be any number of gothic fonts, Hadrian comes to mind as well, except the top of the 'n'.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021142243im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fonts_6276.jpg)

Any ideas?
author: lherrou

comments.content: If the ones Stephen mentioned are not enough, I could list some more examples of what it’s NOT ;-)

\>\> If the ones Stephen mentioned are not enough, I could list some more examples of what it’s NOT ;-)

ummm, gee, thanks... \*grin\* (thinking that could be a pretty long list)

\>\> Could be alternate gothic No 2

I don't see it... the n in my sample is pretty distinctive.

[marten grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021142243/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_marten_grotesque_rg_rg_exp/&sample_text=tfnc&sample_size=144) is quite close...  
But I'd guess it's not it (because of the t bar's position mostly)
Hmmm, that's the closest so far...
